result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Patrick Paar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Patrick Paar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Patrick Paar was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Patrick Paar

defendant.name: Paar, Christopher Patrick
defendant.address: 2140 County Road C, #16, New Richmond, WI 54017

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & Jail. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Christopher Patrick Paar appeared.  Court called at 9:19 a.m.  Set for PTC.  Attorney Andrea advises the court there is an agreement.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 with the domestic abuse enhancer stricken.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 with the domestice abuse enhancer stricken.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1, Ct. 3 & Ct. 4.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: 

- DE sentenced to 6 days in the St. Croix County Jail
- Credit for 6 days already served. 
- Court costs of $243.00 apply money on file
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb ,ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Alex Andrea, DF: Christopher Patrick Paar appeared.  Court called at 10:21 a.m.  Attorney Andrea advises the court the DE is in counseling with his spouse and has gone through a treatment program.  Attorney Andrea is asking for more time for the couple to contine the counseling.  Continue PTC.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 10:23 a.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Notice of Motion to Suppress. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
to Christopher Paar ck# 024367 sent 2/10/15. eif

*AMENDED*
It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tammy P.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea, DF:  Christopher Patrick Paar appeared. Attorney Andrea updates the Court on status. Court amends bond to no abusive contact. Return remaining bond money to payor.
Pre-trial conference on March 11, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 11, 2015 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Post $250.00 before release and balance of $250.00 to be posted Friday January 30, 2015 by 4:30 p.m.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tammy P.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Christopher Patrick Paar appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Defendant does qualify for PD.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Reserves speedy trial. Request for Substitution of Judge filed in Court.
